intro: Pleurothallis sororcula, commonly known as the "sister orchid," is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its flowers are usually short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
